title: PLAZA / GRAFFITO
description:
There's a giant graffito on the plaza outside:
Un jour je serai de retour près de toi

dialogueTree.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The graffito has been painted over..."
dialogueTree.actor: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE
dialogueTree.english: The graffito has been painted over the traces of the fight that took place here. It smells of blood and heavy fuel oil.
dialogueTree.polish: Graffito pokrywa ślady walki, jaka się tu odbyła. Czuć je krwią i ciężkim olejem napędowym.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Графіці пакрываюць сляды бою, які адбыўся тут. Адчуваецца кроў і цяжкае дызельнае паліва.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "This was Cindy the SKULL."
links.english: This was Cindy the SKULL.
links.polish: To była Cindy CZACHA.
links.belarusian: Гэта была Сіндзі ЧАХА.

links.title: You: "Looks like Cindy the SKULL has been..."
links.english: Looks like Cindy the SKULL has been here.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że była tu Cindy CZACHA.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, тут была Сіндзі ЧАХА.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant crouches, touching t..."
links.english: The lieutenant crouches, touching the fuel oil with his finger.
links.polish: Porucznik kuca i dotyka paliwa palcem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант прысядае і дакранаецца пальцам да паліва.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or some other hoodlum. This is sti..."
links.english: "Or some other hoodlum. This is still fresh. It wasn't here yesterday."
links.polish: „Albo jakiś inny chuligan. Wciąż świeże. Wczoraj tu tego nie było”.
links.belarusian: «Ці нейкі іншы хуліган. Дагэтуль свежае. Учора гэтага тут не было».

links.title: Conceptualization: "The Return..."
links.english: The Return...
links.polish: Powrót...
links.belarusian: Вяртанне...

links.title: You: ""Does this have anything to do with..."
links.english: "Does this have anything to do with 'The Return' Klaasje was waiting for?"
links.polish: „Czy to ma coś wspólnego z »Powrotem«, na który czekała Klaasje?”
links.belarusian: «Ці мае гэта нейкае дачыненне да «Вяртання», якога чакала Клаасе?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Could be. In Revachol West, someon..."
links.english: "Could be. In Revachol West, someone somewhere is always whispering about Le Retour..." He squints his eyes at the writing. "It's an *aerograffito*, meant for Coalition aerostatics in the lower troposphere."
links.polish: „Możliwe. W Zachodnim Revacholu ktoś zawsze szepcze o »Le Retour«...” – odpowiada, przyglądając się ze zmrużonymi oczami napisowi. „To *aerograffito* przeznaczone dla koalicyjnych aerostatów przebywających w troposferze”.
links.belarusian: „Магчыма. У Заходнім Рэвашолі нехта заўсёды шэпча пра »Le Retour«...” – адказвае, гледзячы з прыжмуранымі вачыма на надпіс. „Гэта *аэраграфіці* прызначана для кааліцыйных аэрастатаў, якія знаходзяцца ў трапасферы”.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The return to her side."
links.english: The return to her side.
links.polish: Powrót do niej.
links.belarusian: Вяртанне да яе.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.english: Say nothing.
links.polish: Nic nie mów.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Spoken as the something that will o..."
links.english: Spoken as the something that will one day return? Or as the someone who's waiting?
links.polish: Czy mówi to ten, który kiedyś powróci? A może ten, kto czeka?
links.belarusian: Ці кажа гэта той, хто калісьці вернецца? А можа той, хто чакае?

links.title: You: ""Does this have anything to do with..."
links.english: "Does this have anything to do with 'The Return' Klaasje is waiting for?"
links.polish: „Czy to ma coś wspólnego z »Powrotem«, na który czeka Klaasje?”
links.belarusian: «Ці мае гэта нешта агульнае з „Вяртаннем“, якога чакае Кляашэ?»

links.title: You: "Does this have anything to do with'..."
links.english: Does this have anything to do with' The Return' Klaasje was waiting for?
links.polish: Czy to ma coś wspólnego z „Powrotem”, na który czekała Klaasje?
links.belarusian: Ці гэта мае нейкае дачыненне да «Вяртання», якога чакала Клаасе?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Of what and to whom, you think? Spo..."
links.english: Of what and to whom, you think? Spoken as the something that will one day return? Or as the someone who's waiting?
links.polish: Czego i do kogo, jak sądzisz? Czy mówi to ten, który kiedyś powróci? A może ten, kto czeka?
links.belarusian: Чаго і да каго, як ты думаеш? Ці кажа гэта той, хто некалі вернецца? А можа той, хто чакае?

links.title: You: "Does this have anything to do with..."
links.english: Does this have anything to do with 'The Return' Klaasje is waiting for?
links.polish: Czy to ma coś wspólnego z „Powrotem”, na który czeka Klaasje?
links.belarusian: Ці мае гэта нешта агульнае з «Вяртаннем», якога чакае Клааса?

links.title: Inland Empire: "Fresh blood. The return to her side..."
links.english: Fresh blood. The return to her side.
links.polish: Świeża krew. Powrót do niej.
links.belarusian: Свежая кроў. Вяртанне да яе.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The return of light."
links.english: The return of light.
links.polish: Powrót światła.
links.belarusian: Вяртанне свету.

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The red-dyed fuel oil glistens. Thi..."
links.actor: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE
links.english: The red-dyed fuel oil glistens. This was painted very recently.
links.polish: Zabarwiona na czerwono ropa lśni. Dzieło jest naprawdę świeże.
links.belarusian: Пафарбаванае ў чырвонае масла ззяе. Твор сапраўды свежы.

links.title: You: "Looks like Cindy the SKULL finally..."
links.english: Looks like Cindy the SKULL finally found the words for her masterpiece.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że Cindy CZACHA znalazła w końcu słowa do swojego arcydzieła.
links.belarusian: Мне здаецца, што Сіндзі ЧАЦА нарэшце знайшла словы для свайго шэдэўра.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant crouches, touching t..."
links.english: The lieutenant crouches, touching the fuel oil with his finger.
links.polish: Porucznik kuca i dotyka paliwa palcem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант прысядае і дакранаецца пальцам да паліва.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like it, yes. This is still..."
links.english: "Looks like it, yes. This is still fresh. It wasn't here yesterday."
links.polish: „Tak, na to wygląda. Wciąż świeże. Wczoraj tu tego nie było”.
links.belarusian: «Так, выглядае на тое. Да гэтага часу свежае. Учора гэтага тут не было».

links.title: You: "I smell heavy fuel oil."
links.english: I smell heavy fuel oil.
links.polish: Czuję ciężki olej napędowy.
links.belarusian: Я адчуваю цяжкае дызельнае паліва.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And blood. Some of it is even your..."
links.english: "And blood. Some of it is even yours."
links.polish: „I krew. Może nawet jest tam twoja?”
links.belarusian: «І кроў. Можа, нават ёсць там твая?»

links.title: Interfacing: "Heavy fuel oil -- isn't that... fla..."
links.english: Heavy fuel oil -- isn't that... flammable?
links.polish: Ciężki olej napędowy. Czy on nie jest... łatwopalny?
links.belarusian: Цяжкае дызельнае паліва. Хіба яно не з'яўляецца... лёгкаўзгаральным?

links.title: You: "What are you trying to imply, finge..."
links.english: What are you trying to imply, fingers?
links.polish: Co ty kombinujesz, złota rączko?
links.belarusian: Што ты задумваеш, залатыя рукі?

links.title: Interfacing: "You *could* buy some smokes, light..."
links.english: You *could* buy some smokes, light up a ciggy and throw it in there... You know, just to see what happens. See if it's flammable. It's better that way. Safer.
links.polish: *Mógłbyś* kupić fajki, zapalić jednego i nim rzucić w napis. No wiesz, żeby sprawdzić, co się stanie. Czy jest łatwopalny. Tak będzie lepiej. Bezpieczniej.
links.belarusian: *Мог бы ты* купіць цыгарэты, запаліць адну і кінуць яе ў надпіс. Ну, ведаеш, каб праверыць, што адбудзецца. Ці ён лёгка ўзгараецца. Так будзе лепш. Бяспечней.

links.title: You: "No. Nope. No-no-no, bad idea."
links.english: No. Nope. No-no-no, bad idea.
links.polish: O nie. Nie. Nie, nie, nie. To zły pomysł.
links.belarusian: О не. Не. Не, не, не. Гэта дрэнная ідэя.

links.title: Interfacing: "Okay. Sorry. Hooh. Close call."
links.english: Okay. Sorry. Hooh. Close call.
links.polish: Dobra. Przepraszam. Uf, mało brakowało.
links.belarusian: Добра. Прабач. Уф, мала не хапіла.

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "And blood. Some of it may even be y..."
links.actor: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE
links.english: And blood. Some of it may even be yours. Looks like a giant mop was used to turn it into lettering...
links.polish: I krew. Może nawet jest tam twoja? Wygląda, jakby litery stworzono z tej mieszanki za pomocą wielkiego mopa...
links.belarusian: І кроў. Магчыма, нават там ёсць твая? Выглядае, нібы літары створаны з гэтай сумесі з дапамогай вялікай швабры...

links.title: You: ""Step back, lieutenant." (Set the g..."
links.english: "Step back, lieutenant." (Set the graffito on fire with a lit cigarette.)
links.polish: „Odsuń się, poruczniku”. (Podpal graffito zapalonym papierosem).
links.belarusian: «Адыдзіце, лейтэнант». (Падпаліце графіці запаленай цыгарэтай).

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The fuel oil catches fire immediate..."
links.actor: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE
links.english: The fuel oil catches fire immediately with an ominous hiss -- a bright orange flash across the surface of the letters. Black smoke rises from the burning message.
links.polish: Olej natychmiast ulega zapłonowi, wydając z siebie złowrogi syk – powierzchnia liter rozbłyskuje jasnopomarańczowo. Z płonącej wiadomości unosi się czarny dym.
links.belarusian: Алей адразу ўспыхвае, выпушчаючы з сябе злавесны шып – паверхня літар успыхвае ярка-аранжавым. З палаючага паведамлення падымаецца чорны дым.

links.title: Inland Empire: "What if the words are not directed..."
links.english: What if the words are not directed at the people of Martinaise, or even the Coalition aerostatics above the city -- they're meant for something above even those...
links.polish: Co jeśli te słowa nie są kierowane do mieszkańców Martinaise ani nawet do koalicyjnych aerostatów nad miastem, a do kogoś będącego jeszcze ponad nimi...
links.belarusian: Што калі гэтыя словы не адрасаваныя жыхарам Мартынэза або нават кааліцыйным аэрастатам над горадам, а камусьці, хто знаходзіцца яшчэ вышэй за іх...

links.title: You: ""DISCO ELYSIUM.""
links.english: "DISCO ELYSIUM."
links.polish: „DISCO ELYSIUM”.
links.belarusian: «DISCO ELYSIUM».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant has taken a small st..."
links.english: The lieutenant has taken a small step back. He looks at your face illuminated by the flames and nods silently. Then the fire falters...
links.polish: Porucznik cofnął się o mały krok. Przygląda się twojej twarzy oświetlonej płomieniami i kiwa głową w milczeniu. Po chwili płomienie przygasają...
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант зрабіў маленькі крок назад. Ён уважліва глядзіць на тваё твар, асветлены полымем, і маўкліва ківае галавой. Праз момант полымя слабее...

links.title: Empathy: "The flames warmed him too. Not at a..."
links.english: The flames warmed him too. Not at all in a bad way.
links.polish: Płomienie ogrzały i jego. W zupełnie dobry sposób.
links.belarusian: Полымя сагрэла і яго. У зусім добры спосаб.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go to that island.""
links.english: "Let's go to that island."
links.polish: „Ruszajmy na tę wyspę”.
links.belarusian: "Паехалі на гэты востраў".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Time to crack this case. Let's rea..."
links.english: "Time to crack this case. Let's really, really have a close look at that window in Klaasje's room."
links.polish: „Pora rozwiązać tę sprawę. Musimy koniecznie przyjrzeć się bliżej temu oknu w pokoju Klaasje”.
links.belarusian: «Прыйшоў час вырашыць гэтую справу. Мы абавязкова павінны ўважлівей паглядзець на гэта акно ў пакоі Клаasje».

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "The flames warm your face. Then --..."
links.actor: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE
links.english: The flames warm your face. Then -- a gust of cold wind, and the fire falters...
links.polish: Płomienie ogrzewają ci twarz. Po chwili zrywa się zimny wiatr i ogień przygasa...
links.belarusian: Полымя грэе тваё твар. Праз момант падняўся халодны вецер, і агонь патухае...

links.title: Shivers: "IT'S TIME TO GO TO THE ISLAND."
links.english: IT'S TIME TO GO TO THE ISLAND.
links.polish: CZAS UDAĆ SIĘ NA WYSPĘ.
links.belarusian: ЧАС ВЫРУШАЦЬ НА ВОСТРАЎ.

links.title: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE: "Slowly the flames subside, the fuel..."
links.actor: ONE DAY I WILL RETURN TO YOUR SIDE
links.english: Slowly the flames subside, the fuel burning out. The air still smells of mazut -- and springtime.
links.polish: Płomienie powoli przygasają, paliwo ulega wyczerpaniu. Powietrze wciąż czuć mazutem. I wiosną.
links.belarusian: Полымя павольна згасае, паліва заканчваецца. Паветра ўсё яшчэ пахне мазутам. І вясной.

links.title: Logic: "It's time to crack this case. The n..."
links.english: It's time to crack this case. The next logical move is to go back upstairs, to Klaasje's room. Really inspect that window.
links.polish: Czas rozwikłać tę sprawę. Kolejnym logicznym krokiem byłoby iść na górę, do pokoju Klaasje. Uważnie obejrzeć to okno.
links.belarusian: Час разгадаць гэтую справу. Наступным лагічным крокам было б падняцца наверх, у пакой Клаасе. Уважліва агледзець гэтае акно.

links.title: You: ""YOU'VE BEEN POLICED, MARTINAISE.""
links.english: "YOU'VE BEEN POLICED, MARTINAISE."
links.polish: „MARTINAISE POD BUTEM POLICJI”.
links.belarusian: «МАРТИНАЙЗ ПАД БОТАМ МІЛІЦЫІ».

links.title: You: ""GOD. I'M ON MY WAY.""
links.english: "GOD. I'M ON MY WAY."
links.polish: „BOŻE, IDĘ DO CIEBIE”.
links.belarusian: «БОЖА, Я ІДУ ДА ЦЯБЕ».

links.title: You: "Say nothing. Stare grimly into the..."
links.english: Say nothing. Stare grimly into the flames.
links.polish: Nic nie mów. Wpatruj się ponuro w płomienie.
links.belarusian: Нічога не кажы. Узірайся панура ў полымя.

links.title: You: "Set the graffito on fire with a lit..."
links.english: Set the graffito on fire with a lit cigarette.
links.polish: Podpal graffito zapalonym papierosem.
links.belarusian: Падпалі графіці запаленай цыгарэтай.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.english: [Leave.]
links.polish: [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: [Ідзі].
